title: Most UFOs are 'Chinese surveillance' drones and 'airborne clutter,' Pentagon officials reveal
description: The U.S. government has officially started to explain some of the most infamous UFO encounters of the last decade, with China and weather balloons as top offenders.
author: Brandon Specktor

image.alt: A government employee photographed a UFO that hovered for 15 minutes near Holloman Air Development Center in New Mexico, on Dec.16, 1957.

title: Problems with NASA asteroid mission Psyche delay Venus probe's launch to 2031
description: A NASA Venus mission will have to wait at least three more years to launch due to issues with the agency's Psyche asteroid probe.
author: Elizabeth Howell

image.alt: Artist's illustration showing NASA's Psyche probe approaching its asteroid namesake.

title: 'Andor' episode 8 continues its amazing world-building and paints a terrifying view in 'Narkina 5'
description: If the title of 'Star Wars: Episode IV' is 'A New Hope' then the title of 'Andor' episode VII should be 'Abandon All Hope.'
author: Scott Snowden

image.alt: Image for 'Andor' episode 8 continues its amazing world-building and paints a terrifying view in 'Narkina 5'

title: Boeing's 1st Starliner astronaut flight delayed to April 2023
description: The first crewed flight of Boeing's Starliner astronaut taxi has been pushed back by two additional months, to April 2023.
author: Mike Wall

image.alt: Boeing's Starliner capsule docked at the International Space Station.

title: Rocket Lab launches Swedish satellite but fails to catch booster with helicopter
description: Rocket Lab launched a Swedish research satellite to orbit today (Nov. 4) but didn't manage to snag the returning booster with a helicopter.
author: Mike Wall

image.alt: A Rocket Lab Electron rocket launches the MATS satellite for the Swedish National Space Agency on Nov. 4, 2022.

title: SpaceX's next Falcon Heavy rocket launch may fly before Christmas
description: The next SpaceX Falcon Heavy launch date is up in the air, but the most optimistic projections have Viasat-3 flying in December. A Space Force payload is just behind, in 2023.
author: Elizabeth Howell

image.alt: a sideways view of a falcon heavy rocket launching to orbit

title: China's latest giant rocket debris crash blasted by US and European space chiefs
description: The heads of NASA and the European Space Agency have issued statements condemning the latest example of a Chinese Long March 5B rocket booster falling to Earth in an uncontrolled reentry.
author: Brett Tingley

image.alt: Bill Nelson, NASA administrator, speaks during a Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation confirmation hearing on Capitol Hill on April 21, 2021 in Washington, DC.

title: Estes launches SpaceX Falcon 9 as new fly and display model rocket
description: A new Estes' SpaceX Falcon 9 with Crew Dragon model rocket is ready to launch and land just like the real vehicle on which it is based.
author: Robert Z. Pearlman

image.alt: Estes' SpaceX Falcon 9 with Crew Dragon model rocket comes out of the box ready to fly or "land" on desktop display.

title: Confirmed! A 2014 meteor is Earth's 1st known interstellar visitor
description: Astronomers have confirmed that a suspicious space rock that hit Earth in 2014 came from another star system, predating the famous interstellar visitor 'Oumuamua by three years.
author: Tereza Pultarova

image.alt: Most asteroids miss Earth at a safe distance.

title: Save $245 on the Nikon D850 DSLR camera
description:
Deal
That's a huge saving on a Nikon camera that we rate as one of the very best on the market.
author: Alexander Cox

image.alt: A side profile of the Nikon D850

title: Pictures from space! Our image of the day
description: NASA's moon-bound Space Launch System rocket is back on launch pad 39B ahead of its debut test launch which will send the uncrewed Artemis 1. mission for a lunar roundtrip.
author: Space.com Staff

image.alt: NASA's Space Launch System rocket with the Orion capsule atop is back on the launch pad ahead of its debut launch to the moon.

title: Artemis 1 moon rocket arrives at pad for Nov. 14 launch (photos)
description: NASA's Artemis 1 moon rocket arrived at the launch pad Friday morning (Nov. 4) and is now being prepared for launch to the moon in as soon as 10 days.
author: Elizabeth Howell

image.alt: artemis 1 on launch pad beside three launch towers with blue clouds and a pale sky

title: 'Avatar: The Way of Water' trailer dives back into Pandora
description: 20th Century Studios delivers a second full trailer for December's "Avatar: The Way of Water."
author: Jeff Spry

image.alt: Still from "Avatar: The Way of Water."

title: Ukraine invasion's impacts on space exploration: Live updates
description: The Russia-Ukraine war has already stretched into space, with satellites providing internet and intel and longstanding international relations in outer space shifting rapidly.
author: Elizabeth Howell

image.alt: A multispectral satellite images of an artillery battalion actively firing in a southeasterly direction on March 11, 2022 as seen by the WorldView-2 satellite for Maxar Technologies.

title: Mars rover documentary 'Good Night Oppy' rolls into movie theaters today
description: Director Ryan White's heartbreaking documentary "Good Night Oppy" lands in movie theaters.
author: Jeff Spry

image.alt: Good Night Oppy

title: Boeing Starliner: Live updates
description: Read live updates of Boeing's Starliner spacecraft development as it moves towards sending humans to space for the first time.
author: Elizabeth Howell

image.alt: Photo of Boeing's Starliner approaching the ISS by astronaut Samantha Cristoforetti.

title: International Space Station: Live updates
description: Find out what's going on at the International Space Station.
author: Elizabeth Howell

image.alt: Cosmonaut Oleg Novitsky shared this photo of the International Space Station on Twitter on Sept. 29, 2021. He and two colleagues were relocating a Russian Soyuz spacecraft from one port to another at the time.

title: Watch NASA roll Artemis 1 moon rocket to launch pad today
description: NASA's Artemis 1 moon rocket will head back to the launch pad once again early Friday morning (Nov. 4), and you can watch the slow-moving action live.
author: Mike Wall

image.alt: A view of the massive Artemis I Space Launch System rocket and Orion spacecraft at Launch Pad 39B after rolling out from the Vehicle Assembly Building for a second time at the Kennedy Space Center in Florida on June 6, 2022.

title: Whew! 23-ton Chinese rocket debris falls to Earth over Pacific Ocean
description: A 23-ton rocket body from China's launch of a Long March 5B rocket has fallen safely into the south-central Pacific Ocean after creating questions over where it will come down once again.
author: Brett Tingley

image.alt: Map of possible trajectories for falling Chinese space junk showing a South Pacific impact

title: On This Day In Space: Nov. 4, 2015: 'Super Strypi' rocket fails to launch
description: On Nov. 4, 2015, the United States Air Force's launch of an experimental rocket from Hawaii failed. See how it happened in our On This Day In Space series.
author: Hanneke Weitering

image.alt: The U.S. Air Force’s rail-launched Super Strypi rocket lifted off from Hawaii about 9:45 p.m. local time on Nov. 3, 2015,, roared toward the sky and failed less than a minute into the long-awaited flight.

title: A massive space rock impact may have kickstarted Earth's magnetic field
description: The interplanetary collision that formed the moon might have more connections to Earth's ancient history than we ever imagined.
author: Elizabeth Howell

image.alt: illustration of one world crashing into another with lots of flame shooting into space

title: See the moon visit Jupiter in the sky on Friday (Nov.4)
description: Skywatchers will have an excellent opportunity to spot Jupiter on Friday when the moon makes a close approach in the sky to the massive gas giant, the largest planet in the solar system.
author: Robert Lea

image.alt: An illustration of the night sky on Nov. 4 depicting a gibbous moon visiting Jupiter in the sky.

title: Don't miss the Beaver Blood Moon lunar eclipse on Nov. 8
description: The second lunar eclipse of 2022 – a total lunar eclipse – will happen on the morning of Tuesday, Nov. 8 when the moon moves into the darkest part of Earth's shadow.
author: Robert Lea

image.alt: A total eclipse Blood Moon as seen on May 26, 2021 in Auckland, New Zealand.

title: Record breaker! Newfound black hole is closest known to Earth
description: A black hole 10 times more massive than our sun lurks just 1,560 light-years from Earth — about twice as close as the previous proximity champ.
author: Mike Wall

image.alt: Artist's illustration of Gaia BH1, a black hole in a binary system that lies just 1,560 light-years from Earth. The system also harbors a sun-like companion star.

title: A 23-ton Chinese rocket will fall to Earth Friday. But when and where will it land?
description: A huge hunk of Chinese space junk is expected to crash back to Earth on Friday (Nov. 4), but nobody knows exactly where or when it will come down.
author: Mike Wall

image.alt: A Long March 5B heavy-lift rocket and the Mengtian space lab at the Wenchang Spacecraft Launch Site on October 25, 2022 in Wenchang, Hainan Province of China.

title: NASA X-ray observatory reveals how black holes swallow stars and spit out matter
description: The X-ray binary system Cygnus X-1 is chomping on matter stolen from a companion star.
author: Keith Cooper

image.alt: An artist’s impression of the Cygnus X-1 X-ray binary, which features a black hole stripping material from a companion star, and the material forming a hot accretion disk.

title: Virgin Galactic releases roadmap for its new space tourist spaceship
description: Virgin Galactic will partner with Axiom Space to give astronauts a brief weightless experience, and it has new suppliers to build the next-generation Delta spaceship in 2023.
author: Elizabeth Howell

image.alt: close up of spaceshiptwo firing its engines in space with earth visible as a blurry blue area to the right

title: Artemis 1 moon rocket 'ready to go' for Nov. 14 launch, NASA says
description: While NASA officials stressed that Artemis 1 continues to be a challenging mission, they stated they are confident in the upcoming launch attempt on Nov. 14.
author: Brett Tingley

image.alt: NASA's Artemis I rocket sits on launch pad 39-B at Kennedy Space Center on September 03, 2022 in Cape Canaveral, Florida.

title: Elusive neutrinos caught streaming from a black hole hidden in dust
description: A unique observatory buried in pristine Antarctic ice detected a stream of elusive neutrino particles streaming from the center of a distant galaxy obscured with dust.
author: Tereza Pultarova

image.alt: Front view of the IceCube Lab at twilight, with a starry sky showing a glimpse of the Milky Way overhead and sunlight lingerin​​g on the horizon.

title: Record-breaking Hunga Tonga volcanic plume might have warmed Earth's climate
description: The Hunga Tonga volcanic eruption that sent shockwaves through Earth in January 2022 generated the highest volcanic cloud since at least the Krakatoa eruption of 1883, scientists have found.
author: Tereza Pultarova

image.alt: In January, one of the most powerful volcanic eruptions in modern history took place in the Pacific.

title: Epic galaxy collision hints at answer to missing matter mystery
description: Astronomers using NASA's Chandra Observatory to watch galaxy collisions in the cluster Abell 98 have found what may be evidence of the universe's missing matter.
author: Elizabeth Rayne

image.alt: Composite image of Abell 98

title: Launch of North Korea's most powerful ballistic missile fails: reports
description: North Korea continued its barrage of missiles Thursday (Nov. 4) with an apparently failed launch of its most powerful ICBM.
author: Elizabeth Howell

image.alt: missile blasting off on television with korean text captioning. a passerby watches nearby the television

title: China's falling Long March 5B rocket stage spotted from space (photos)
description: A large Chinese rocket stage predicted to make an uncontrolled reentry into Earth's atmosphere on Friday (Nov. 4) has been imaged by an orbiting satellite.
author: Andrew Jones

image.alt: A Long March 5B rocket carrying the Mengtian module for China's Tiangong space station launches on Oct. 31, 2022.

title: 'Star Trek' memorial flight adds 2 more names to its Enterprise mission
description: Celestis' Enterprise Flight includes two more esteemed "Star Trek" creators in their 2023 memorial mission
author: Jeff Spry

image.alt: ULA's Vulcan Centaur Heavy-Lift Launch Vehicle

title: Unlock the secrets of the ice giants with All About Space magazine
description: All About Space issue 136 explores Neptune and Uranus like never before, taking a peek into the unknown. Explore the latest issue here.
author: Daisy Dobrijevic

image.alt: All About Space issue 136 cover

title: Don't miss the brilliant Taurid meteor shower next week
description: During a one-week time frame extending from Nov. 5th through Nov. 12, the Taurid meteor shower will be most active.
author: Joe Rao

image.alt: A bright Taurid meteor descends across a sky featuring a glowing aurora over Lake Simcoe on Nov. 9, 2015

title: US Air Force will unveil its advanced new B-21 Raider stealth bomber on Dec. 2.
description: On Dec. 2, the world will finally get a glimpse at the B-21 Raider, a new stealth bomber that has been described as "the most advanced military aircraft ever built."
author: Brett Tingley

image.alt: An image of the new B-21 Raider hidden under a shroud.

title: Europe warming twice as fast as rest of the world, new report reveals
description: The European continent is bearing the brunt of climate change, warming at a rate that is twice as fast as the global average, a new report found.
author: Tereza Pultarova

image.alt: A mosaic of Europe composed of thousands of satellite observations.

title: SpaceX launches Hotbird 13G telecom satellite, lands rocket at sea
description: SpaceX launched a telecom satellite to orbit and landed a rocket on a ship at sea early Thursday (Nov. 3).
author: Mike Wall

image.alt: A SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket launches the Hotbird 13G satellite for Eutelsat on Nov. 3, 2022.

title: North Korea launches record 23-missile barrage
description: North Korea launched 23 short-range ballistic missiles on Wednesday (Nov. 2), a record-breaking fusillade that spurred a response from its neighbor to the south.
author: Mike Wall

image.alt: Commuters sit on a train under a television showing a news broadcast with file footage of a North Korean missile test, on the outskirts of Seoul on Nov. 2, 2022.

title: Another huge piece of Chinese space junk is falling to Earth. 'Here we go again,' experts say
description: Another Chinese Long March 5B rocket body will once again plummet to Earth in the coming days above a yet-to-be-determined location.
author: Brett Tingley

image.alt: A Long March 5B Y3 carrier rocket was launched from the Wenchang Space Launch Centre in China’s Hainan province on July 24. Some of its debris fell into the Indian Ocean.

title: SpaceX will fly 2 Saudi astronauts to space station on private Axiom Space mission
description: NASA and Axiom Space are adding two Saudi astronauts to the Ax-2 manifest that already includes a NASA astronaut and a motorsports racing driver.
author: Elizabeth Howell

image.alt: view of a dragon spacecraft docked with the international space station. the black of space is visible in the background

title: Milky Way stars photobomb picturesque spiral galaxy in stunning Hubble photo
description: The Hubble Space Telescope captured the sight of a beautiful spiral galaxy, adorned with the sparkle of two nearby stars.
author: Doris Elin Urrutia

image.alt: Spiral galaxy NGC 5495 in the constellation Hydra.

title: Is China's mysterious space plane about to return to Earth?
description: China's mysterious space plane ejected an object on Oct. 31, perhaps signaling that its time in orbit is nearly up.
author: Mike Wall

image.alt: China's mysterious orbital space plane may be similar to the U.S. Space Force's robotic X-37B, seen here in a 2009 photo.

title: Scientists discover largest gas cloud in space that's 20 times bigger than the Milky Way
description: Glowing in the Pegasus constellation are five apparently closely packed galaxies known as Stephan's Quintet — and they are whispering the secrets of galactic evolution to scientists.
author: Elizabeth Rayne

image.alt: Red depicts a massive cloud of atomic hydrogen surrounding the interacting galaxies nicknamed Stephan's Quintet.

title: Russia launches possible missile-tracking satellite amid continuing threats
description: The country has been threatening to act against U.S. commercial satellites looking at Ukraine, which Russia invaded in February.
author: Elizabeth Howell

image.alt: rocket lifting off in between two launch towers with blue sky in behind

title: NASA's InSight Mars lander has just weeks left to live
description: NASA's marsquake-hunting InSight mission is almost at an end, as dust is choking off the Red Planet lander's solar power supply.
author: Elizabeth Howell

image.alt: view of a spacecraft filled with dust

title: 'Why Am I Taller?' explores what happens to the human body in space
description: Space.com sat down with authors Elizabeth Howell and Dave Williams to discuss their new book on how spaceflight affects the human body, 'Why Am I Taller?'
author: Brett Tingley

image.alt: Cover art for "Why Am I Taller?" depicting an astronaut in a spacesuit standing on Mars.

title: 'Star Wars' is back in Fortnite with Luke, Leia, Han Solo and lightsabers!
description: Bring "A New Hope" into your Fortnite experience with fresh "Star Wars" content, available through Nov. 8.

image.alt: collage of star wars images in fortnite including luke skywalker, a ship, a ball and a weapon

description: This awesome new Lego Marvel Hulkbuster set is available to VIP members from November 4 and the general sale from November 9.

title: Satellites help scientists see how coral reefs are dealing with climate change
description: Scientists are developing a new method that uses satellite images to assess how coral reefs fare amid climate change.
author: Tereza Pultarova

image.alt: Satellite images reveal how sand aprons within coral reefs evolve overtime.

title: 'Dune: House Harkonnen' comic brings back fan-favorite floating fiend
description: Boom! Studios will release a new "Dune" comic series in 2023 titled "Dune: House Harkonnen."

image.alt: Dune: House Harkonnen

title: Astronaut candidates' fly-shaped class patch is a lunar 'slam dunk'
description: NASA's astronaut candidates are giving new definition to "fly me to the moon" with their patch. "The fly-shaped patch represents our class, 'The Flies,'" wrote ascan Anil Menon on Instagram.

image.alt: The class patch for NASA's 23rd group of astronaut candidates, nicknamed "The Flies."

title: NASA's tiny CAPSTONE moon probe overcomes glitch, sets sights on lunar orbit
description: NASA's tiny CAPSTONE probe has bounced back from a troubling glitch and is on track to reach the moon this month as planned.

title: Watch a 'ring of fire' eclipse play out from space in epic new Hinode satellite footage
description: A partial solar eclipse on Oct. 25 looked like an epic ring of fire when viewed by the Hinode satellite, new footage reveals.

image.alt: A satellite view of the partial solar eclipse seen on Oct. 25, 2022.

title: SpaceX launch of Japanese moon lander, UAE rover delayed to Nov. 22

Buying Guide

title: Dead and alive at the same time: Black holes have quantum properties

image.alt: An illustration of a mass-quantised black hole.

title: November full moon 2022: Full Beaver Blood Moon gets a total lunar eclipse
description: November's full "Beaver Moon" will occur on Nov. 8 and will undergo a total lunar eclipse.

title: See the first quarter moon join Saturn in the sky tonight (Nov. 1)
description: Catch Saturn making a close approach of the moon in its first quarter phase on Tuesday (Nov. 1).

title: SpaceX now targeting December for 1st Starship orbital launch: report
description: NASA says that SpaceX plans to resume its Starship test-flight program in December with an orbital try. But that's not confirmed yet.

image.alt: starship spacecraft in mid-air with the pointy side facing towards the ground. smoke is in behind

title: Amazing photos from SpaceX's Falcon Heavy USSF-44 mission

title: Evidence of ancient Mars ocean increases probability of past life
description: New evidence of an ancient ocean on Mars suggests excellent past conditions for the existence of life.
author: Robert Lea

image.alt: Zooming in on Aeolis Dorsa, a region of Mars created by an ancient ocean and an ideal area to search for signs of ancient life.

title: SpaceX's Falcon Heavy, world's most powerful rocket, launches US military satellites in 1st flight in 3 years
description: SpaceX's Falcon Heavy, the world's most powerful rocket currently in operation, took flight this morning (Nov. 1) for the first time in more than three years.

title: Quarks: What are they?
description:
Reference
Quarks are elementary particles that are the building blocks of all visible matter in the universe. Explore them in more detail here.

title: Rocket startup Orbex signs lease to build UK's first vertical spaceport

author: Tereza Pultarova

image.alt: The Prime small satellite launcher awaiting tests on a launch pad in Scotland.

title: SpaceX rolls out Falcon Heavy rocket ahead of Tuesday launch (photo)

author: Mike Wall

description: Ignite Films releases 70th anniversary Blu-ray and 4K UHD restoration of 1953's classic sci-fi tale "Invaders From Mars."

image.alt: A still from 'Invaders From Mars'

title: NASA's Artemis 1 moon rocket 'on track' to roll out to pad Friday (Nov. 4)
description: NASA's Artemis 1 moon rocket is once again headed back to the launch pad on Friday (Nov. 4) ahead of its historic lunar mission.

image.alt: A view of the massive Artemis I Space Launch System rocket and Orion spacecraft at Launch Pad 39B after rolling out from the Vehicle Assembly Building for a second time at the Kennedy Space Center in Florida on June 6, 2022.

title: 'Play ball!' Space station astronauts celebrate World Series with an orbital pitch
description: A Japanese astronaut briefly doubled as catcher as NASA astronauts celebrated their hometown Houston Astros meeting the Philadelphia Phillies in the end-of-season series.
author: Elizabeth Howell

image.alt: astronaut holds a baseball close by a camera and in behind is a grey space station module filled with equipment and a few balls representing earth and mars

title: China launches mysterious Shiyan-20C satellite to orbit (video)

author: Mike Wall

image.alt: A Long March 2D rocket launches China's Shiyan-20C satellite to orbit on Oct. 28, 2022.

title: Collapsed Arecibo Observatory reveals final 'treasure trove' to defend Earth from asteroids
description: The study is the largest ever on radar observations of near-Earth asteroids.
author: Andrew Jones

image.alt: This aerial view shows a hole in the dish panels of the Arecibo Observatory in Arecibo, Puerto Rico, on Nov. 19, 2020.

title: NASA plans its second human moon landing on Artemis 4 after all: report
description: Artemis 4 will land on the moon as soon as 2027 instead of continuing to build out a supporting NASA-led lunar station called Gateway.
author: Elizabeth Howell

image.alt: artemis astronaut stepping on to the moon with the shadow of a lunar lander in behind

title: Mars moon mystery: Strange structures found inside 'fearful' Phobos
description: Europe's Mars Express spacecraft has peered deep into the subsurface of the Martian moon Phobos, finding unknown structures that could reveal the moon's origin.
author: Keith Cooper

image.alt: A close-up of the Martian moon Phobos.

title: Satellite peers at a creepy iceberg's 'Halloween crack' (photo)
description: The iceberg tip is "hanging by a thread" due to ongoing climate change in Antarctica.
author: Elizabeth Howell

image.alt: satellite image of an iceberg (at bottom) beside the weddell sea. an illustrated line in red shows the position of the halloween crack, along with explanatory text

title: Haunting photo of dead 'ghost star' a cosmic Halloween treat

author: John Loeffler

image.alt: This image shows a spectacular view of the orange and pink clouds that make up what remains after the explosive death of a massive star — the Vela supernova remnant.

title: China launches final module to complete Tiangong space station (video)

description: The eerie Hubble Space Telescope image was released for the "spooky season" surrounding Halloween
author: Andrew Jones

image.alt: Galaxy cluster Abell 611, located roughly 3.2 billion light years from Earth.

title: 'Planet killer' asteroid found hiding in sun's glare may one day hit Earth
description: A giant asteroid that might one day cross paths with Earth has been discovered hiding in the glare of the sun.
author: Tereza Pultarova

image.alt: Twilight observations with the U.S. Department of Energy-fabricated Dark Energy Camera at NOIRLab’s Cerro Tololo Inter-American Observatory in Chile have enabled astronomers to spot three near-Earth asteroids hiding in the glare of the sun.

title: Asteroids threatening Earth could be spotted by network of spacecraft near Venus' orbit, Chinese scientists say
description: We could detect potentially hazardous near-Earth asteroids by using six surveyor spacecraft deployed in Venus-like orbits, Chinese researchers propose.
author: Andrew Jones

image.alt: grey rock against black background

title: Halloween night sky 2022: See Jupiter, Mars and maybe some spooky fireballs
description:
Reference
Skies will be mainly clear tonight (Oct. 31) across the contiguous United States; making for ideal Halloween skywatching conditions. What will you be looking out for?
author: Joe Rao

image.alt: photograph of smiling pumpkins carved into different faces with the night sky above with constellations such as the Big Dipper, and Cepheus visible above.

title: Watch SpaceX's Falcon Heavy launch for 1st time since 2019 today
description: After more than three years, SpaceX's Falcon Heavy — the world's most powerful operational rocket — is about to launch again.

title: NASA has a life-detecting instrument ready to fly to Europa or Enceladus
description: OWLS, the Ocean Worlds Life Surveyor, would autonomously search for life on the icy moons of the outer solar system.
author: Keith Cooper

image.alt: icy moon with small geysers shooting out

title: Launch of advanced JPSS-2 weather satellite delayed to Nov. 10
description: JPSS-2 and the LOFTID technology demonstration will now launch no earlier than Nov. 10, in part because a battery on the upper stage of their Atlas V rocket ride needs to be replaced.
author: Mike Wall

image.alt: The United Launch Alliance Atlas V payload fairing containing the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration’s Joint Polar Satellite System-2 satellite arrives at the vertical integration facility at Space Launch Complex-3 at Vandenberg Space Force Base in California on Oct. 18, 2022.

title: NASA seeks origin of 'weird' fast-spinning dwarf planet Haumea
description: The dwarf planet Haumea may be the weirdest object in the solar system. Now NASA researchers may finally understand how it was formed.
author: Robert Lea

image.alt: An artist's illustration of the strage, fast-spinning dwarf planet Haumea and its two moons and rings.

title: Dracarys! This spiral galaxy in the constellation Draco is helping astronomers measure the universe
description: Unlike House of the Dragon, the bright heat from this celestial monster is nothing to be feared. In fact, it's a super helpful tool that helps gauge the expansion of the universe.
author: Doris Elin Urrutia

image.alt: The spiral galaxy UGC 9391 130 million light-years from Earth is seen by the Hubble Space Telescope's Wide Field Camera 3 in this image released Sept. 30, 2022.

title: A skyscraper-sized 'potentially hazardous' asteroid will zip through Earth's orbit on Halloween
description: A newly discovered, "potentially hazardous" asteroid almost the size of the world's tallest skyscraper is set to tumble past Earth just in time for Halloween, according to NASA.
author: Ben Turner

image.alt: An artist's impression of a near-Earth asteroid.

title: 'Star Trek: Defiant' comic sees Worf and Spock form a dream team crew
description: IDW Publishing is releasing new comic book series "Star Trek: Defiant" in March of 2023.
author: Jeff Spry

image.alt: Cover art from "Star Trek: Defiant."

title: Curious Kids: What is exotic matter, and could we use it to make wormholes?
description: Curious Kids: what is exotic matter, and could we use it to make wormholes? – Julia, aged 14, London
author: Carolyn Devereux

image.alt: An illustration of what the inside of a wormhole might look like. Swirls of various colors in a tube-like shape streak throughout a field of stars..

title: Hubble telescope peeks through 'cosmic keyhole' in stunning photo
description: Hubble has just grabbed a brilliant new photo of a cosmic 'keyhole' in a stellar nursery
author: John Loeffler

image.alt: This peculiar portrait from the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope showcases NGC 1999, a reflection nebula in the constellation Orion. It appears as a light blue cloud in space with a keyhole-shaped 'hole' in the center.

title: Get $70 off the Celestron AstroMaster 130 EQ telescope
description:
Deal
The Celestron AstroMaster 130EQ reflector telescope is best suited to beginners and is now $70 off on Amazon.
author: Alexander Cox

image.alt: Celestron - AstroMaster 130EQ Newtonian Telescope

title: See NASA destroy its vintage Marshall Space Flight Center headquarters (video)
description: NASA destroyed one of its own vintage buildings early Saturday (Oct. 29), sending the vintage structure off with a literal bang.
author: Mike Wall

image.alt: NASA destroyed its old headquarters Building 4200 at the Marshall Space Flight Center in Huntsville, Alabama in a controlled implosion on Oct. 29, 2022.

title: This Week In Space podcast: Episode 35 —A Man on the Moon with author Andy Chaikin
description: On today's This Week in Space, Rod Pyle and Tariq Malik speak with acclaimed author Andy Chaikin about his epic Apollo record A Man On the Moon and moon exploration.
author: Space.com Staff

image.alt: This Week In Space title card with views of Rod Pyle, Tariq Malik and Andy Chaikin

title: Space photos: The most amazing images this week!
description: A supernova boasts spooky tendrils, a Milky Way star photobombs a galactic portrait and NASA's moon rocket returns to the launch pad. These are some of this week's top stories.
author: Doris Elin Urrutia

image.alt: This image shows a spectacular view of the orange and pink clouds that make up what remains after the explosive death of a massive star — the Vela supernova remnant.

title: The top space stories of the week!
description: Largest-known gas cloud in space is surrounding Stephan's Quintet, NASA is confident that Artemis I will launch Nov. 14 and a rocket part safely crashes into the Pacific Ocean. These are some of this week's top stories.
author: Doris Elin Urrutia

image.alt: Red depicts a massive cloud of atomic hydrogen surrounding the interacting galaxies nicknamed Stephan's Quintet.

title: Red Planet's massive dust storm finally weakening as Mars changes seasons
description: A massive dust storm on Mars that threatened a NASA lander is finally fading away.
author: Meghan Bartels

image.alt: Photo of NASA's InSight Mars lander with dust-covered solar array on April 24, 2022..

title: NASA study calls for Apollo site protection among lunar surface ops policies
description: A new NASA study has found that the protection of the Apollo landing sites remains a concern. The report, though, recommends "extreme restraint" in seeking protection for future heritage sites.
author: Robert Z. Pearlman

image.alt: For the first time, NASA is having to consider policies for operating missions on the moon in proximity to other actors, including the need to protect and preserve past and future heritage sites.

title: Advanced Earth-monitoring JPSS-2 satellite is 'go' for liftoff on Nov. 1
description: The powerful JPSS-2 satellite is go for liftoff early Tuesday morning (Nov. 1) — provided the weather cooperates.
author: Mike Wall

image.alt: The United Launch Alliance Atlas V payload fairing containing the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration’s Joint Polar Satellite System-2 satellite arrives at the vertical integration facility at Space Launch Complex-3 at Vandenberg Space Force Base in California on Oct. 18, 2022.

title: Join the hunt for elusive spooky sprites in the sky with this 'Spritacular' project
description: A new crowdsourcing science project called "Spritacular" is asking skywatchers to use their digital cameras to try to capture images of unusual electrical discharges above thunderstorms.
author: Keith Cooper

image.alt: Sprites (arrowed) spotted from orbit by Expedition 44 astronauts on board in the International Space Station in 2015.

title: Stratolaunch's Roc, the world's largest plane, aces 1st flight carrying hypersonic prototype
description: Stratolaunch flew a prototype of its planned air-launched Talon hypersonic vehicle for the first time on Friday (Oct. 28).
author: Tariq Malik

image.alt: Stratolaunch's giant carrier plane Roc and its Talon-A testbed above the runway with dust behind

title: NASA won't cancel Psyche asteroid mission, targets October 2023 launch
description: NASA will continue to develop its troubled Psyche asteroid mission, with the aim of launching it in October 2023 — a year later than planned.
author: Mike Wall

image.alt: Artist's illustration showing NASA's Psyche probe approaching its asteroid namesake.

title: Listen to the terrifying rumble of Earth's magnetic field being assaulted by a solar storm
description: If you're seeking something unsettling from space this October, this audio track provides a disturbing sonic representation of the Earth's magnetic field under attack.
author: Andrew Jones

image.alt: An artist's depiction of Earth's magnetic field protecting the planet.

title: Next-generation inflatable Mars landing gear to get a test during launch on Nov. 1
description: Technology that could help humanity land heavy hardware on Mars will get an in-space test early next week.
author: Mike Wall

image.alt: Artist's illustration of NASA's Illustration of Low-Earth Orbit Flight Test of an Inflatable Decelerator (LOFTID) in orbit.

title: James Webb Space Telescope snaps new, super-spooky image of Pillars of Creation
description: The James Webb Space Telescope pulled a creepy trick in a new image of the Pillars of Creation: making the stars "disappear" by focusing on a different wavelength of light.
author: Elizabeth Howell

image.alt: two pillars of dust in blue wavelengths with a red infrared glow in space behind

title: Venus-bound NASA instrument preparing to brave the harsh atmosphere
description: NASA scientists are preparing to paint the most detailed picture to date of the atmosphere of Venus when the aptly named DAVINCI mission drops a probe to the planet's surface.

image.alt: small round probe against yellow sky and background

title: Watch Europe's Solar Orbiter get up close and personal with the sun's corona (video)

image.alt: The highest-resolution video sequence of the sun's upper atmosphere, the corona, was taken by the Europe-led Solar Orbiter mission.

title: Getting space junk under control may require an attitude shift

title: The 25 scariest spaceflight moments show dangers in orbit and beyond
description: There are quite a few times in history when crews ran into trouble, and got out again. That's why good training for the extreme environment of space is a must.
author: Elizabeth Howell

image.alt: Astronaut Robert Stewart during Manned Maneuvering Unit (MMU) Exercise untethered above the Earth on Feb. 11, 1984.

title: White House says US would respond if Russia targets commercial satellites
description: The White House has responded to Russia's assertion that commercial satellites are legitimate targets by stating that a U.S. response would follow any such attacks.

title: Powerful new Earth-monitoring satellite JPSS-2 to study weather's 'butterfly effect'

title: Chinese launch next week will set stage for another big space-junk crash

title: SpaceX hasn't flown a Falcon Heavy rocket since 2019. Here's why.

title: SpaceX gearing up for 1st Falcon Heavy launch since 2019 (photo)

title: Scorching 'super-Earth' hot enough to melt gold may have lost its atmosphere
